marketNews.title: BI Holds Interest Rate Amid Rupiah Weakness
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (12/18) decided to maintain the BI Rate benchmark interest rate at the level of 6%, with the deposit facility and lending facility maintained at 5.25% and 6.75% respectively. This decision is in line with consensus expectations. Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated that this decision was taken due to high global economic uncertainty, especially regarding the direction of US policy and the escalation of geopolitical tensions in various regions. Perry mentioned that this uncertainty is driving the strengthening of the US dollar, with the DXY index having strengthened by +1.2% MTD to the level of 107 as of Wednesday (12/18) following fund flow migration towards that country. Bank Indonesia's decision to maintain the BI Rate is also related to the narrowing room for US interest rate cuts following Trump's victory. Based on the CME FedWatch Tool analysis, the probability of a US interest rate cut of >=75 bps until June 2025 dropped from the level of 62.7% (11/5) before Trump's victory, to 37.1% as of Wednesday (12/18). The above macro developments caused the Rupiah exchange rate to decline against the US Dollar by -1.5% MTD to the level of 16,090. Nevertheless, Perry believes that the current Rupiah exchange rate is still relatively under control and is confident that it will remain stable going forward, in line with Bank Indonesia's commitment to maintaining stability, attractive government bond yields, low inflation, and good economic growth prospects.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Hawkish interest rate sentiment has pushed capital out of the IHSG, with net foreign outflow reaching 10.1 trillion Rupiah in the last 1 month as of December 17, 2024. On the other hand, Indonesian government bond yields generally rose. This moment can be utilized by investors to lock in higher bond yields, such as PBS032 (maturing in 1.5 years) offering a yield of 6.76% or FR0076 (maturing in 23 years) offering a yield of 7.12%.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia noted that the growth of banking credit disbursement slowed to +10.79% YoY in 11M24 (vs. 10M24: +10.92% YoY). Credit growth was mainly supported by investment credit (+13.77% YoY), working capital credit (+8.92% YoY), and consumption credit (+10.94% YoY). Meanwhile, Sharia financing during 11M24 grew by +11.24% YoY and MSME credit growth reached +4.02% YoY. Bank Indonesia projects credit growth in 2024 will be in the target range of around +10-12% and will increase to the range of +11-13% in 2025.

marketNews.title: Government Plans to Lower MSME Tax-Free Turnover Threshold
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, said that the government plans to lower the turnover threshold for MSMEs that can utilize the final MSME income tax (PPh) rate from the current level of 4.8 billion Rupiah per year to 3.6 billion Rupiah per year. Susiwijono mentioned that this discourse is based on recommendations from the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD).

marketNews.title: Renewable Energy Mix Target Will Be Missed, EBT Investment Realization Only Reaches 57.3% of Target
marketNews.content: The Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, stated that the Ministry predicts the energy mix from new and renewable energy (EBT) plants as of December 2024 will reach 14.1% (vs. 2023 realization: 13.09%), still far from the 23% target in 2025. Meanwhile, investment realization in the EBT sector since the beginning of 2024 reached 1.49 billion US dollars, only fulfilling 57.3% of the 2024 target of 2.6 billion US dollars.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Reports Honda and Nissan Exploring Potential Merger to Take on Toyota
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Honda Motor Co. (TYO: 7267) and Nissan Motor Co. (TYO: 7201) are exploring a merger plan. Honda Executive Vice President, Shinji Aoyama, told Bloomberg that they are considering several options including a merger, capital consolidation, or the formation of a holding company. Bloomberg sources stated that one option being considered is the formation of a new holding company under which the combined business will operate. The transaction could also be extended to include Mitsubishi Motors Corp. (TYO: 8058) which has a capital tie with Nissan. If realized, this deal would consolidate the Japanese automotive industry into 2 main camps: the Honda, Nissan, and Mitsubishi camp, and the Toyota group camp.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Again Buys 91.7 Million SCMA Shares
tickerNews.content: SCMA: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased 91.7 million SCMA shares at an average price of 180.5 Rupiah per share on December 16-17, 2024. The total transaction value reached 16.6 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 61.32% to 61.44%. This transaction marks EMTK's 4th purchase of SCMA shares since the beginning of December 2024, following purchases of 87 million (0.12%) shares on December 4-5, 2024, 68 million (0.09%) shares on December 6-9, 2024, and 100 million (0.14%) shares on December 11, 2024.

tickerNews.title: KKGI to Distribute Interim Dividend of 15 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: KKGI: Resource Alam Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend of 15 Rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is December 30, 2024, with payment on January 17, 2025. Referring to the closing price of KKGI shares on Wednesday (12/18) at 525 Rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.9%.

tickerNews.title: Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd. Buys 982,500 SILO Shares, Increasing Stake to 63.45%
tickerNews.content: SILO: The controller of Siloam International Hospitals, Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd., purchased 982,500 SILO shares at an average price of 2,850 Rupiah per share on December 16, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.8 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd.'s ownership in SILO increased from 63.44% to 63.45%. This transaction marks the 2nd purchase of SILO shares by Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd. in December 2024 after the purchase of 1.05 billion (8.04%) shares on December 11, 2024.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Sells 389,752 Tons CO2e Carbon Credits to Controller, Prepares for Geothermal Drilling in Aceh
tickerNews.content: PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy announced the sale of carbon credits amounting to 389,752 tons CO2e from Geothermal Power Plant Lahendong Unit 5 & 6 Volume 3 to its controller, PT Pertamina Power Indonesia (PPI). The total net profit received by PGEO from this transaction is 755,000 US dollars or 12.4 billion Rupiah. In a separate disclosure, PGEO stated its readiness to carry out geothermal drilling in the Seulawah Agam WKP, Aceh Besar, with PT Pembangunan Aceh. Currently, the project with a geothermal energy potential of up to 320 MW is in the land acquisition preparation stage, with drilling implementation planned to start in 2025.

tickerNews.title: Report: Deputy President Director Gregory Hendra Lembong Poised to Replace Jahja Setiatmadja as BBCA CEO
tickerNews.content: Katadata reported that the Deputy President Director of Bank Central Asia, Gregory Hendra Lembong, will replace Jahja Setiatmadja as the President Director of BBCA. Katadata sources also mentioned that Jahja will replace Djohan Emir Setijoso as the President Commissioner of BBCA. Djohan himself submitted his resignation letter on December 16, 2024, where this resignation will be discussed in the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS) in 2025. BBCA has not yet commented on this issue.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Signs Credit Facility of up to 15 Million USD for EV Ecosystem Development, Subsidiary Secures 23.3 Million USD Loan for Solar Power Project
tickerNews.content: TOBA: TBS Energi Utama signed a credit facility of up to 15 million US dollars, originating from PT Bank DBS Indonesia (up to 5 million US dollars) and Asian Development Bank (up to 10 million US dollars). The funds are intended to finance the company's subsidiaries, PT Energi Kreasi Bersama and PT Manufaktur Kreasi Bangsa, to develop an integrated electric vehicle business ecosystem. In a separate disclosure, TOBA's business entity, PT Nusantara Tembesi Baru Energi, signed a loan of 23.3 million US dollars from PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur to finance a 42 MW floating solar power plant (PLTS) project in Batam, Riau Islands.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Targets 10-15 New Stores in 2025, Lower Than 2024 Target of 20 New Stores
tickerNews.content: The Director of Hartadinata Abadi ($HRTA), Thendra Chrisnanda, stated that they are targeting an addition of about 10-15 stores during 2025, lower than the 2024 target of 20 new stores. Thendra mentioned that HRTA will be more selective in store additions due to challenges expected next year, such as the VAT increase to 12%.

tickerNews.title: CBRE Secures 5-Year Time Charter Contract for Supramax Bulk Carrier
tickerNews.content: Cakra Buana Resources Energi ($CBRE) obtained a time charter lease contract for 1 unit of 57,000 DWT supramax bulk carrier vessel from PT Sys Petrolindo Utama. The value of the contract reaches 145 million Rupiah per day for 5 years, with an option to extend the contract for 2 years.
